data.title: Lot's of history here.
data.text: You won't be disappointed. It was interesting for my family, having recently moving here from the Great White North. But, everyone talks funny down here.

data.title: An impressive state hoise
data.text: This was number 19 of state houses for my family. The grounds are nice. We took the guided tour Kathy was our guide and she was superb. We really enjoy the short film at the beginning of the tour wish all state houses had them. There is so much history in the building. Copper dome truly a beauty to see.

data.title: Such a beautiful place to visit!
data.text: The SC State House offers amazing history, interesting architecture, gorgeous green lawns and sidewalk paths perfect for a stroll to admire the flowers, and you can even run the stairs for a great workout!  Add this beautiful place to your must see list!

data.title: Visiting our Student
data.text:
Hi All,

This place is filled with history. My wife and I took a self guided tour. There was plenty of historical things to see on the property. 
The building and grounds are beautiful. 
It was a great way to kill an afternoon.

data.title: History and Sculptures
data.text: What a wonderful surprise to find an entire area dedicated to our (Black) history on the east side of the South Carolina State House! The sculptures are beautiful! Be sure to bring a camera as the flowers, trees, and scenery demand photography. We only walked around the outside but plan to return for the inside tour. Sunday afternoon was perfect for that. We parked on the side street and did not have to walk up the steps.

data.title: History and architecture...
data.text: The grounds and surrounding areas are full of sculptures. The tour was excellent. We were hoping to see the governor because she was in her office but her staff was there and looked very busy. The renovation done on this building is outstanding! The artwork of some of the people representing South Carolina gave us a better understanding of their history. The guide told us that we were welcome to watch sessions anytime. Afterwards we walked the streets and many historical signs to complete our day!

data.title: Very nice surprise!
data.text: My wife and I were in the area and decided to take a self guided your of the State House and I am very glad we did. It is a beautiful place with a lot of history. We learned a lot about Columbia and South Carolina and spent a bit more time than we planned to due to the many things to see there. Very glad we took this tour.

data.title: So much history
data.text: We did a self guided tour and learned about the history of the state house. Believe it or not Pokemon go taught us much about the history also by taking us to spots around the grounds. My favorite part was seeing the damage from prior attacks. Really puts things into perspective. Grounds are peaceful and beautiful to walk around.  Entrance to the building is on the lower level side. Inside is also very quiet and chock full of history.

data.title: Do visit!
data.text: Interesting guided tour. Well worth doing if visiting Columbia. Paintings and architecture are great.

data.title: State House historic and beautiful
data.text: The state house is beautiful on the inside. Admission is free. If your in downtown and showing your visiting friends/relatives around stop by.

data.title: Fun Tour
data.text: My 6 year old actually even enjoyed the tour...beautiful building and lots of history, love the cannon ball markers on the outside plus really pretty grounds now

data.title: A little uncomfortable
data.text: Felt as though I was unwelcome. Beautiful interior and classic exterior but everywhere I turned I had eyes on me. I was alone in shorts with a camera, yet felt as if I would make everyone more comfortable by leaving... so i did

data.title: Family tour of the State House
data.text:
We entered from Sumter St. which made the walk into the Capitol much easier especially for older folks or lazy ones. The grounds had benches and walking paths that were shaded by the many trees which took you away from the noise of the city and allowed for a nice stroll to the Capitol. 

You may take a guided tour which is offered every 1/2 hour or so or you may stroll through the Senate and House areas including the chambers. Plus you may visit with the Governor if she has time or the Lieutenant Governor if he has time and which we did for a few minutes.

The chambers, plaques and other memorabilia provide a look back into South Carolina's history are well worth the view and read. One describes many boys about 15 years old that lost their lives in the civil war.

The State Capitol is listed on the National Register and it seems that it sits an earthquake fault line.

data.title: Nice night view
data.text: An impressive structure nicely illuminated for night viewing... Stopped after a lovely dinner and late night stroll back to the hotel...

data.title: History
data.text: Beautiful grounds and lots of history.   Look for the gold stars on the side of the building for where cannon balls hit during the war.    Good museum inside.

data.title: historic
data.text: Gained great knowledge during our walk-through. Kid friendly our children had a good time all a while grasping interesting historic information.

data.title: A must see in Columbia
data.text: This place has so much history in it's doors.  The people that helped the state earn it's independence from England as well as become it's own state!  There are memorials to everyone who did even the smallest incredible act of kindness!

data.title: Great place
data.text: Beautiful grounds with statuary, history, architecture and gardens all for free as you walk the area at your leisure.

data.title: SC State Capitol
data.text:
The building's history is great, but one would be overcome with nausea from the aura of the turncoat congressmen and governor!
PS: Deo Vindice!!!!!

data.title: This place is incredible!
data.text: Just the outside grounds and views of the building are enough to wow you but wait till you get inside. Absolutely breathtaking! So much adventure! The kids loved it as did we.
